data.text: Thanks everyone, negative this morning.. But wow, how amazing is the design and thinking behind these little tests.. Never would I before believe I would be testing myself for a highly contagious disease in my bedroom before going to work! Well done to the inventors! 👏
@DrPhilCummins Yes, agree.. but was sitting next to the Education CEO who said nothing when she suggested we do it before we walk into school.

@AdamJFitzgerald You still need to follow the instructions … and make it work … like we always make things work despite the situation … I’m sure the CEO doesn’t mean poorly … just poorly informed … the opportunity to respond constructively and fill in the gaps is always in our grasp …
@AdamJFitzgerald Yeah stuff that. Good luck with the tests.
@Simmo___ Ha, I'm all right with all of that, apart from the last bit, I don't do "short runs." 😃
@AdamJFitzgerald Do it after gargling barley water, while wearing a garlic lanyard and always while standing on your head. Post test, drink 9 cups of apricot juice and go for a short run.

@AdamJFitzgerald @Simmo___ The instructions say to blow your nose first. 

Sterilise your hands before opening containers.

Allow 10 minutes in the morning, I normally count to 10 for each nostril to make sure I get enough mucus on the sterile q-tip.

Should have result after 10 minutes.
@MsMLoy @Kelly_J_Scott Yes, it's crazy because remember when our State Government wanted to avoid surveillance testing every couple of days, now with this we have 80% of teachers testing daily. 🤷‍♂️
@DrPhilCummins Funny, because our SA Health CEO said to do it just before we walk into work, which kind of doesn't work for teachers, as relief teachers don't just appear in minutes.
